title: How does music influence society? - Quora

response.answer_text: I would point you to the excellent documentary ‘The History of Rock and Roll’. All the singers from the 60’s unanimously agree that their music was intended to change the world but all it really did was reinforce beliefs held by those who listened to it and agreed with it. In other words, a racist person is not going to listen to ‘All You Need Is Love’ and have an epiphany. People wrote a metric ton of protest songs aimed at George W. Bush and it changed nothing. People are writing songs about Trump now and it changes nothing. Willie Nelson has even expressed his disappointment with Trump and he probably has a ton of fans that voted for Trump. He says he’ll likely lose them but he doesn’t care. What music does do, however, is affect the way we dress. What we eat and drink. What car we drive. Where we live. All these things because somewhere deep down inside we all want to be like our favorite artists. Or maybe they are our favorite artists because they share our tastes. Who knows.
